newsitem.title: CANADA: Bloc, Liberals almost tied in Quebec - poll.
newsitem.headline: Bloc, Liberals almost tied in Quebec - poll.

text.p: The separatist Bloc Quebecois and the ruling Liberals are neck and neck in Quebec ahead of the June 2 federal election, a new poll published on Wednesday showed.

The May 9-12 survey of 1,002 Quebeckers by the SOM polling firm for the Quebec City daily newspaper Le Soleil showed 37 percent support for the Bloc and 36 percent for the Liberals after the redistribution of undecided voters. The Conservatives were third at 19 percent.

Among French-speaking Quebeckers, who make up about 84 percent of the province's residents, the Bloc led the Liberals by 45 percent to 28 percent, with the Conservatives at 19 percent after redistributing the undecideds.
The margin of error was 3.7 percent, 19 times out of 20.
